title: Bug 49195: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description:
When specifying <Server port="1" in server.xml, there is an error message printed in the catalina.20100427.log file. The message is as follows: 
27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServer
SEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.
However, despite this error message, Tomcat actually stops successfully as Catalina.stopServer() performs System.exit(1) after printing the message. It should be noted that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalina.server is not null.
OB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service, an error message stating that there is no shutdown port configured is printed in catalina.20100427.log.
EB: It would be better to use wait(10000) instead of sleep(10000) in StandardServer.await() method. This way, the method could be woken by a notifyAll() call or by using the interrupt() call to wake it up if we know the thread.
